thrust.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: She thrust a letter into my hand.
He thrust me roughly towards the door.
thrust.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to make a sudden movement forward with a sword or knife
thrust.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: He skipped aside as his opponent thrust at him.
thrust.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a sudden strong movement in which you push something forward
thrust.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: He jumped back to avoid another thrust of the knife.
thrust.translation[1].definitions[1].def: the main meaning or aim of what someone is saying or doing
thrust.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: the main thrust of the governmentâ€™s education policy
thrust.translation[1].definitions[2].def: the force of an engine that makes a car, train, or plane move forward
